bestFor: Rapid prototyping and high-throughput image generation using the `go_fast` optimization
Projects requiring the integration of third-party LoRA weights from CivitAI or HuggingFace
Generating cutting-edge quality images just below state-of-the-art performance
Commercial use of generated images (when run on Replicate)
notGoodFor: Applications requiring absolute output determinism (especially when `go_fast` is enabled)
Generating verifiably factual or specific real-world information
Use cases highly sensitive to existing societal biases
Users unfamiliar with optimized prompting techniques
styleStrengths: Adaptable styles defined by external LoRAs
summary.typicalUseCase: A user wants to quickly render high-resolution concepts in a specific custom style by leveraging a popular LoRA found on CivitAI, prioritizing fast iteration speed over perfect determinism.

keyParameters.lora_weights: Allows loading external style weights from HuggingFace, CivitAI, or Replicate.
keyParameters.go_fast: Enables faster, fp8 quantized inference, but disables deterministic outputs.
keyParameters.lora_scale: Determines the applied strength of the main LoRA weight (default 1).
keyParameters.num_inference_steps: Controls the balance between quality and speed (recommended range 28-50).

promptingTips: Experiment heavily with prompting style, as the model's output is highly influenced by text structure.
Utilize `lora_scale` and `extra_lora_scale` to precisely control the influence of custom weights.
For faster results, enable `go_fast` and reduce `num_inference_steps` to the lower end (around 28).
Provide `civitai_api_token` or `hf_api_token` if accessing authenticated LoRA models.
summary.comparisonToAlternatives: Offers cutting-edge output quality and competitive prompt following, placing it just below the state-of-the-art FLUX.1 [pro] model but generally matching the performance of closed-source alternatives.

seed.description: Random seed. Set for reproducible generation

image.description: Input image for image to image mode. The aspect ratio of your output will match this image

go_fast.description: Run faster predictions with model optimized for speed (currently fp8 quantized); disable to run in original bf16. Note that outputs will not be deterministic when this is enabled, even if you set a seed.

extra_lora.description: Load LoRA weights. Supports Replicate models in the format <owner>/<username> or <owner>/<username>/<version>, HuggingFace URLs in the format huggingface.co/<owner>/<model-name>, CivitAI URLs in the format civitai.com/models/<id>[/<model-name>], or arbitrary .safetensors URLs from the Internet. For example, 'fofr/flux-pixar-cars'

lora_scale.description: Determines how strongly the main LoRA should be applied. Sane results between 0 and 1 for base inference. For go_fast we apply a 1.5x multiplier to this value; we've generally seen good performance when scaling the base value by that amount. You may still need to experiment to find the best value for your particular lora.

megapixels.description: Approximate number of megapixels for generated image

aspect_ratio.description: Aspect ratio for the generated image

hf_api_token.description: HuggingFace API token. If you're using a hf lora that needs authentication, you'll need to provide an API token.

lora_weights.description: Load LoRA weights. Supports Replicate models in the format <owner>/<username> or <owner>/<username>/<version>, HuggingFace URLs in the format huggingface.co/<owner>/<model-name>[/<lora-weights-file.safetensors>], CivitAI URLs in the format civitai.com/models/<id>[/<model-name>], or arbitrary .safetensors URLs from the Internet, including signed URLs. For example, 'fofr/flux-pixar-cars'. Civit AI and HuggingFace LoRAs may require an API token to access, which you can provide in the `civitai_api_token` and `hf_api_token` inputs respectively.

output_quality.description: Quality when saving the output images, from 0 to 100. 100 is best quality, 0 is lowest quality. Not relevant for .png outputs

prompt_strength.description: Prompt strength when using img2img. 1.0 corresponds to full destruction of information in image

extra_lora_scale.description: Determines how strongly the extra LoRA should be applied. Sane results between 0 and 1 for base inference. For go_fast we apply a 1.5x multiplier to this value; we've generally seen good performance when scaling the base value by that amount. You may still need to experiment to find the best value for your particular lora.

civitai_api_token.description: Civitai API token. If you're using a civitai lora that needs authentication, you'll need to provide an API token.

num_inference_steps.description: Number of denoising steps. Recommended range is 28-50, and lower number of steps produce lower quality outputs, faster.

disable_safety_checker.description: Disable safety checker for generated images.
